meanings.definition: Resembling muscle in appearance or function.
meanings.sent1: The myoid texture of the fabric made it look strong and tough.
meanings.sent2: The myoid vines twisted around the tree trunk, mimicking the strength of muscles.
meanings.sent3: The myoid clouds in the sky seemed to flex and stretch as if they were doing a workout.
meanings.sent4: His determination was myoid, firm and unyielding like a solid muscle.
meanings.sent5: The myoid grip of the rock climber kept him steady on the steep cliff.

meanings.definition: A cell or tissue resembling muscle.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the myoid appeared similar to muscle cells.
meanings.sent2: The myoid in the organ helped with its contraction and movement.
meanings.sent3: The myoid in the plant seemed to pulse and flex as if it had a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a myoid, contracting and expanding with each beat.
meanings.sent5: The myoid of the artificial limb allowed for natural movement and flexibility.
